name: St. Martin de Porres

locations.description: Dominican lay brother in Lima, Peru

summary: Martin de Porres was a Peruvian Dominican lay brother of mixed race (African and Spanish). Despite facing discrimination due to his mixed heritage, he became known for his humility, charity, and care for the sick and poor. He established an orphanage and children's hospital and was known for his miraculous abilities, including bilocation and healing. He is the patron saint of mixed-race people, barbers, and public health workers.
keyQuotes: I cure them, not I, but God who cures through me.
